page.title: 17The welfare of Thurlow
page.content: The population of Little Thurlow is approx 190 and Great Thurlow 180. The biggest age group seems to be between 50 & 60 and the smallest the under 10s. About half the population was born here. Doctors and dentists are based in Haverhill but a Monday village surgery is held where about 20 patients from Thurlow and Bradley attend. A day care centre for the housebound adn infirm is available in Haverhill with door to door service but currently no-one from the area attends. A police officer based at Haverhill visits several times a week both day and night, and attends Parish Council meetings and visits the school. The incidence of crime or disturbance here is very low mainly limited to the odd bicycle thrown in the river or a late night driver colliding with a tree.
